SEARCH
Module softeng.gc30
Package it.polimi.ingsw.distributed.rmi

Class ServerRMIImpl

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.distributed.rmi.ServerRMIImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Server, ModelListener, Serializable, Remote, EventListener
public class ServerRMIImpl extends UnicastRemoteObject implements Server, ModelListener
The `ServerRMIImpl` class represents the server-side implementation for the RMI communication protocol. It implements the `Server` interface and extends the `UnicastRemoteObject` class.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ServerRMIImpl

      public ServerRMIImpl(Game model, GameController controller, First first) throws RemoteException
      Constructs a new ServerImpl object.
      Parameters:
      model - The Game object representing the game model.
      controller - The GameController object controlling the game.
      first - The First object is used to ask the first player connected the number of players in the game.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if there is a communication-related issue.

    • ServerRMIImpl

      public ServerRMIImpl(int port) throws RemoteException
      Constructs a new ServerImpl object with the specified port.
      Parameters:
      port - The port number for the server.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if there is a communication-related issue.

    • ServerRMIImpl

      public ServerRMIImpl(int port, RMIClientSocketFactory csf, RMIServerSocketFactory ssf) throws RemoteException
      Constructs a new ServerImpl object with the specified port, RMIClientSocketFactory, and RMIServerSocketFactory.
      Parameters:
      port - The port number for the server.
      csf - The RMIClientSocketFactory to be used for creating client sockets.
      ssf - The RMIServerSocketFactory to be used for creating server sockets.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if there is a communication-related issue.

    • clientConnection

      public void clientConnection(Client c) throws RemoteException
      Handles the client connection process.
      Specified by:
      clientConnection in interface Server
      Parameters:
      c - The client being connected.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote exception occurs.

    • checkingExistingNickname

      public void checkingExistingNickname(Client c, String nickName) throws RemoteException
      Checks the existing nickname for a client during reconnection to the already existing game. If the nickname is valid and matches an existing player, the client is considered reconnected. The necessary updates and notifications are sent to the client and other players. If the nickname is invalid or does not match any existing player, an appropriate warning is sent to the client.
      Specified by:
      checkingExistingNickname in interface Server
      Parameters:
      c - the client requesting reconnection
      nickName - the nickname provided by the client for reconnection
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs

    • clientNickNameSetting

      public void clientNickNameSetting(Client c, String nickName) throws RemoteException
      Sets the nickname for a client during the initial connection. If the player's nickname is valid and successfully set, the client is considered connected. The necessary updates and notifications are sent to the client and other players. If the player's nickname is invalid or cannot be set, an appropriate warning is sent to the client.
      Specified by:
      clientNickNameSetting in interface Server
      Parameters:
      c - the client requesting nickname setting
      nickName - the nickname chosen by the client
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs

    • tileToDrop

      public void tileToDrop(int tilePosition) throws RemoteException
      Forwards the tile position to the game controller to handle the tile dropping logic.
      Specified by:
      tileToDrop in interface Server
      Parameters:
      tilePosition - the position of the tile to be dropped
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs

    • checkingCoordinates

      public void checkingCoordinates(int[] coordinates) throws RemoteException
      The server forwards the coordinates to the game controller to perform the necessary checks.
      Specified by:
      checkingCoordinates in interface Server
      Parameters:
      coordinates - the coordinates to be checked
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs

    • columnSetting

      public void columnSetting(int c) throws RemoteException
      Sets the chosen column by the current player. The server invokes the `setChosenColumn` method on the game controller to set the chosen column for the current player.
      Specified by:
      columnSetting in interface Server
      Parameters:
      c - the column to be set
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs

    • endsSelection

      public void endsSelection() throws RemoteException
      Signals the end of the tile selection phase. The server invokes the `selectionControl` method on the game model to indicate that the tile selection phase has ended.
      Specified by:
      endsSelection in interface Server
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs

    • numberOfParticipantsSetting

      public void numberOfParticipantsSetting(int n) throws RemoteException
      Sets the number of participants for the game. This method is used to set the number of players participating in the game. It synchronizes access to ensure thread safety.
      Specified by:
      numberOfParticipantsSetting in interface Server
      Parameters:
      n - the number of participants to set
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs

    • newMessage

      public void newMessage(Client client, String message) throws RemoteException
      Adds a new chat message to the game. This method is used to add a new chat message to the game's chat log. The message is associated with the specified client. It delegates the task to the controller to handle the addition of the chat message.
      Specified by:
      newMessage in interface Server
      Parameters:
      client - the client associated with the message
      message - the chat message to add
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs

    • pong

      public void pong() throws RemoteException
      Pong method used for checking server connectivity. This method is invoked by the client to send a "pong" signal to the server, indicating that the client is still connected. It is used for checking the server's connectivity status. The server implementation of this method does not perform any specific action.
      Specified by:
      pong in interface Server
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs

    • printGame

      public void printGame()
      Prints the game view for each connected client. This method iterates over the connected clients and sends the game view to each client to be printed. The game view contains the current state of the game for the corresponding player. If a remote communication error occurs while printing the game view for a client, an error message is displayed and the update is skipped for that client.
      Specified by:
      printGame in interface ModelListener

    • warning

      public void warning(Warnings e, Player currentPlayer)
      Sends a game warning to the corresponding client. This method sends a game warning to the client associated with the specified player. If the current server instance is responsible for the player, the warning message is sent to the client using the associated client object. If a remote communication error occurs while sending the warning message, an error message is displayed and the update is skipped.
      Specified by:
      warning in interface ModelListener
      Parameters:
      e - The game warning to send.
      currentPlayer - The player for whom the warning is intended.

    • newTurn

      public void newTurn(Player currentPlayer)
      Notifies the clients about a new turn in the game. This method notifies all connected clients about a new turn in the game. If it is not the last turn, each client's `newTurn` method is called with a boolean parameter indicating whether it is their turn. If it is the last turn, each client's `lastTurn` method is called instead. If a remote communication error occurs while notifying the clients, an error message is displayed and the update is skipped.
      Specified by:
      newTurn in interface ModelListener
      Parameters:
      currentPlayer - The player who is currently taking the turn.

    • askOrder

      public void askOrder()
      Asks the current player for their order. This method is used to ask the current player for the order of the chosen tiles in the game. If the client is RMI (determined by the `isMine` method), the `askOrder` method of the corresponding client object is called to ask the player in the UI for the order. If a remote communication error occurs while asking the current player for the order, an error message is displayed and the update is skipped.
      Specified by:
      askOrder in interface ModelListener

    • isLastTurn

      public void isLastTurn()
      Notifies the clients about the last turn in the game. This method is used to notify all connected clients that it is the last turn in the game. It sends a notification to each client using the `lastTurnNotification` method, passing the nickname of the current player. If a remote communication error occurs while notifying the clients about the last turn, an error message is displayed and the update is skipped.
      Specified by:
      isLastTurn in interface ModelListener

    • askColumn

      public void askColumn()
      Asks the current player to choose a column. This method is used to ask the current player to choose a column where to drop their chosen tiles. It first checks if the current player is the local player using the `isMine` method. If the current player is the local player, it retrieves the current player from the model and uses the `askColumn` method of the corresponding client to request the column choice. If a remote communication error occurs while asking the current player for the column, an error message is displayed and the update is skipped.
      Specified by:
      askColumn in interface ModelListener

    • askAction

      public void askAction()
      Asks the current player to perform an action. This method checks if the current player is the local player by invoking the isMine() method. If the current player is the local player, it retrieves the corresponding client from the connected clients map using the current player's nickname. Then, it calls the client's askAction() method to prompt the current player to perform an action.
      Specified by:
      askAction in interface ModelListener

    • finalPoints

      public void finalPoints(String winnerNickname)
      Sends the final points to all connected clients. This method retrieves the final points for each player from the game model and stores them in a map where the player's nickname is mapped to their points. Then, it iterates over all connected clients and calls their finalPoints method, passing the map of final points as an argument.
      Specified by:
      finalPoints in interface ModelListener
      Parameters:
      winnerNickname - the nickname of the winner

    • gameStarted

      public void gameStarted(Player currentPlayer)
      Notifies all connected clients that the game has started. This method sends a notification to each connected client indicating whether the game has started or not. It iterates over all connected clients and checks if the client corresponds to the current player. If it does, the client's gameStarted method is called with a parameter value of true; otherwise, it is called with a parameter value of false. It is used to set the state in the UI if it's the player's turn or not.
      Specified by:
      gameStarted in interface ModelListener
      Parameters:
      currentPlayer - the player who is the current player in the game.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if a remote communication error occurs.

    • warning

      public void warning(Warnings errorType, String nickname)
      Sends a warning message to a specific client. This method sends a warning message to a client with the specified nickname. It iterates over all connected clients and checks if the nickname matches the client's nickname. If there is a match, the client's warning method is called with the specified error type as the parameter.
      Specified by:
      warning in interface ModelListener
      Parameters:
      errorType - the type of warning/error to send.
      nickname - the nickname of the client to send the warning to.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if a remote communication error occurs.

    • playerDisconnected

      public void playerDisconnected(String nickname)
      Notifies all clients about a player disconnection and checks if there are enough remaining players. This method notifies all connected clients about a player disconnection with the specified nickname. It iterates over all connected clients and calls their clientDisconnected method with the nickname as the parameter. After notifying the clients, it checks the number of remaining connected players. If there is only one player remaining, it sends a warning message to the last remaining client to wait for more players to join.
      Specified by:
      playerDisconnected in interface ModelListener
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the disconnected player.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if a remote communication error occurs.

    • playerReconnected

      public void playerReconnected(String nickname)
      Notifies all connected clients that a player has reconnected. This method sends a notification to all connected clients that a player with the specified nickname has reconnected. It iterates over the connectedClients map and calls the client's `clientReconnected` method, passing the nickname as a parameter. If a RemoteException occurs during the process, it is rethrown as a RuntimeException.
      Specified by:
      playerReconnected in interface ModelListener
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the reconnected player
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if a RemoteException occurs while notifying the clients

    • resumingTurn

      public void resumingTurn()
      Notifies all connected clients about the resumption of a turn. This method sends a notification to all connected clients about the resumption of a turn. It iterates over the `connectedClients` map and calls the client's `resumingTurn` method, passing a boolean value indicating whether it is the turn of the current player or not. If the client's nickname matches the nickname of the current player, the method is called with `true`, otherwise with `false`. If a `RemoteException` occurs during the process, it is rethrown as a `RuntimeException`.
      Specified by:
      resumingTurn in interface ModelListener
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if a `RemoteException` occurs while notifying the clients
